reviewText:
I agree with Emily's review from 12/15/14.  The first Gabba live DVD (shot in LA at the Nokia theater) is palpably more energetic, exciting, and better in sound and performance.  This one repeats most of that one's songs and segments, albeit with different sequencing, with a few Gabba Christmas songs thrown in, and Leslie Hall doing "Story Time" where we had a "Super Music Friends" performance in the original. The performances are comparatively tired.  I can't put my finger on it but it's just not as exciting as the first live DVD.  In my opinion, the sound (2 channel stereo only) and picture are not as good as the first. I'm also convinced that some of this was shot on a sound stage, as there are lots of close-up cuts with Lance Rock looking directly into the camera and singing. This is not a big deal, but it is a pet peeve of mine (ever since realizing much of Led Zeppelin's "Song Remains The Same" concert footage was actually shot 6 months later on a sound stage).  There are also no bonus features, whereas the first one had a good half hour of alternate performances.

All that being said, my 3-year old son loves it and has watched it at least 5 times in 5 days. Then again, he loves anything Gabba.

Net-net, if you are deciding between this live Gabba DVD (Beacon Theater) and the other one ("Live at the Nokia Theater"), I absolutely recommend the Nokia Theater DVD over this one.

My child loved the first Gabba Live DVD so I figured this one would be great too. But compared to the first it is disappointing. It is a much smaller scale show and most of the songs and things are the same as the first, they just do it wearing hats and scarves instead.
great price fast delivery thank you
We love Yo Gabba Gabba! We've been to 2 of the live shows and this show didn't come to our city. My 3 year old is really into Christmas this year, and this is perfect!!
Should be a hit the little guy is Gaba Gaba nuts we will see after Christmas

My 3 year old son LOVES this! It was his first time ever watching a yo gabba gabba live dvd, and he was so into it! He sang and danced around the living room like he was there watching the show lol. I would definitely recommend this dvd to anyone who's child (ren) love yo gabba gabba!
